question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• Data Center GPU revenue was very strong in Q3 2024 [C5]
• Data Center GPU revenue was approaching the size of the compute business, which was around $1.7 billion [C6]
• September actuals for Data Center GPU were in the $1.5 billion range [C4]
• AMD raised overall Data Center GPU guidance for 2024 from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion [C5]
• The guidance increase was based on completion of customer milestones and ramping above initial expectations [C5]
• December Data Center GPU revenue projected to be in the $2 billion range [C4]
 Final Answer:
Data Center GPU Revenue: ~$1.5B in September, approaching $1.7B for Q3 (guidance raised to exceed $5B for full year 2024) [C4][C5][C6]
AMD's Data Center GPU segment delivered very strong Q3 performance, with revenue approaching the size of their compute business at around $1.7 billion [C6]. September actuals were approximately $1.5 billion [C4]. The company raised full-year 2024 guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion, representing a $500 million increase [C5]. This guidance raise was driven by completion of customer milestones and ramping above initial expectations [C5]. December revenue is projected to reach approximately $2 billion [C4].
Quarterly growth rates and margins: Not found in provided sources.

metadata.text: we had a very strong quarter for the Data Center overall in Q3 and especially for the Instinct product portfolio.         "Hi, guys. Thanks for taking my question. But the first one, I wanted to go back to what you said about the size of the Data Center GPUs in the quarter. So I guess the question is number one, is that the size of the business that you're talking about in Q3? And is that the kind of level of growth you're thinking into Q4?
